Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Scrimmage \Scrim"mage\ (?; 48), n. [A corruption of skirmish. ``Sore scrymmishe.'' --Ld. Berners.] [Written also {scrummage}.] 1. Formerly, a skirmish; now, a general row or confused fight or struggle. [1913 Webster]
2. (Football) The struggle in the rush lines after the ball is put in play. [1913 Webster]
scrimmage n 1: (American football) practice play between a football team's squads 2: a noisy riotous fight [syn: {melee}, {battle royal}] v : practice playing (a sport)
